result.execSummary:
The defendant Bret E. Noltner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3)(a).
  • Misconduct/Office-Act/Excess Authority, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.12(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any other probation now serving

miscConds.notes:
You shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person or by any other means with: Victim 1

Defendant prohibited from working in any correctional or rehabilitation settings.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions. 

Defendant is to be supervised as a sex offender and required to sex offender assessment and any recommended treatment or conditions. 

Register as a sex offender for 15 years. 

The defendant is ORDERED  to report to the Jackson County Jail to submit the required DNA specimen and report for booking No Later than end of day Friday 8/26/2022.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Must pay all costs of supervision and court ordered financial obligations during the term of probation.

timeConds.notes: Must report to the Jackson County Jail on or before  09/23/2022 no later than 6 pm. Sheriff is to maintain the authority to determine the manner is which conditional jail is served or whether EMP allowed.

records.addlTxt: Blank DNA submission order

10:56 AM Defendant Bret E. Noltner appeared by video.  Attorney Bernardo Cueto appeared by video for Bret E. Noltner.  Attorney Emily Hynek appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Defendant understands and agrees to appear remotely. State in victim compliance. Defendant enters a plea of NC to amended count 1, plea of NC to count 3. 

Court reviewed the elements and potential penalties of the charge the defendant plead to.  He understood.   Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant. Felony warnings given.  He understood. Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of  3rd Degree Sexual Assault contrary to 940.225(3)(a) and  Misconduct/Office-Act/Excess Authority contrary to 946.12(2). Count 2 & 4 DRI.  Defendant exercised his right to allocution. 

Joint recommendation: withhold sentence, 5 yrs probation, 1 yr conditional jail, sheriff should maintain the authority to determine the manner is which conditional jail is served, no contact w/victim 1, be supervised as a sex offender and required to sex offender assessment and any recommended treatment or conditions. CC, register as a sex offender for 15 yrs after supervision discharge. Prohibited from working in any correctional or rehabilitation settings. 37 days jail credit. 

Court adopts joint recommendation: withholds sentence, orders 5 yrs probation on each count with conditions of 1 yr conditional jail, sheriff to maintain the authority to determine the manner is which conditional jail is served or whether EMP allowed. No contact with Victim 1, be supervised as a sex offender and required to sex offender assessment and any recommended treatment or conditions.  
Ordered to report to jail no later than 6 pm on 9/23.  Prohibited from working in any correctional or rehabilitation settings. CC 37 days jail credit. Register as a sex offender for 15 years. Cash bond on file to be applied to Count 1. 

The defendant is ORDERED  to report to the Jackson County Jail to submit the required DNA specimen and report for booking no later than friday 8/26. Contact the Jackson County Sheriff's Department at 715-284-5357 to arrange for an appointment.
